snippet: Ryanair, which was making its third attempt to acquire the troubled Irish carrier, threatened to appeal the decision made by European regulators.
abstract: Ryanair says it has been informed that regulators plan to block the airline's nearly 700 million euro ($942 million) bid for Aer Lingus, the airline's third attempt to acquire the troubled Irish carrier.
lead_paragraph: Ryanair, which was making its third attempt to acquire the troubled Irish carrier, threatened to appeal the decision made by European regulators.

headline.main: Ryanair Says Aer Lingus Bid Will Be Rejected
headline.print_headline: Ryanair Says Regulators Plan to Deny Aer Lingus Bid
